Functions.air_distance module

Functions.air_distance.haversine(center_latitude: float, center_longitude: float, point_latitude: float, point_longitude: float) → float[source]

Calculate the great circle distance between two points on the earth specified in decimal degrees :param center_latitude: Latitude of the first point (actual center) :param center_longitude: Longitude of the first point (actual center) :param point_latitude: Latitude of the second point :param point_longitude: Longitude of the second point :return: Air distance from the first to the second point

Functions.data_analyze module

class Functions.data_analyze.DataAnalyse(center_lat: float, center_long: float)[source]

Bases: object

Class that have methods that is used in Analyse.ipynb for making ML model

data_mean_by_distance(filt: ndarray, distance_from_center: float, plus_minus_km: float)[source]

Func helping analyse the df :param filt: Filter for using df[filter] :param distance_from_center: Haversine from center (lat,long) to house :param plus_minus_km: For exp. if it is 2 the result will be distance_from_center - 2 to distance_from_center + 2 :return: returns mean value

data_median_by_distance(filt: ndarray, distance_from_center: float, plus_minus_km: float)[source]

Func helping analyse the df :param filt: Filter for using df[filter] :param distance_from_center: Haversine from center (lat,long) to house :param plus_minus_km: For exp. if it is 2 the result will be distance_from_center - 2 to distance_from_center + 2 :return: returns median value

distance_price_dependence_plot(filt: ndarray, min_km: float = 0, max_km: float = 250, min_price: int = 0, max_price: int = 1000000)[source]

Price dependence from distance :param filt: = (analyze.df[‘category_from_list’] == ‘commercial-estate-offices-rent’) :param min_km: minimum distance from center :param max_km: maximum distance from center :param min_price: minimum price :param max_price: maximum price :return: returns plot

Find outlaiers depending on price

Parameters:

  • plot – plotin if plot=True

Returns:

series that is outlaiers

price_per_square_meter(filt: ndarray) → float[source]

Price of square meter of item :param filt: filter for data :return: float, price for each meter

Functions.get_latitude_longtitude module

Functions.get_latitude_longtitude.getting_lat_long(id: int)[source]

Retrieves the latitude and longitude values associated with a given ID from a web page on list.am.

Parameters:

id – The ID of the item for which latitude and longitude are to be retrieved.

Returns:

A list containing the latitude and longitude values [latitude, longitude], or None if the values cannot be found in the response.

Transform Boolean type. This function maps a boolean value representing the presence of a garden to an integer value. :param item: Bool value :return: int The transformed integer value.
